And those big projects with lots of changes were often done without setting up the proper training initiatives or resources to learn the material prior to being live with that program or systems. Then those senior directors start blaming property managers or are used as scapegoats when various teams throughout the company are confused and uncertain how to proceed and mistakes and errors become overwhelmingly apparent. And then these same senior directors turn around and use threats of discipline and termination or simply lay off staff when it's their poor planning and execution of these big projects inevitably begin failing. Turning to the H/R team for any assistance when it's apparent you have been targeted for speaking up about any of this was essentially like jumping out of the frying pan and right into the fire. Metaphorically, a huge bulls eye target was placed on my back where trumped-up allegations were raised against me. Allegations that, when common sense is applied, were all nonsense and may have more to do with me as an individual person than my job performance. Undoubtedly, the worst company I have ever worked for, as what they say they stand for or believe in is far from how they act or what they do. The shabby state of the property where I worked should have been my warning sign while interviewing for this job, as it was indicative of the shabby way in which I was treated as an employee.

title: The Truth about working at ELS Managed Properties
pros: This company has so much potential to be great, but they continue to fail. Working at the ELS corporate office in Chicago probably has some 'Pros' but working elsewhere not so much.
cons: Considering applying for a job with ELS? Please do not. Allow me to first state the fact that all of the somewhat positive reviews of this company are from employees in the Chicago corporate office. Working there is probably great and entirely different. However, working for one of the ELS managed properties around the country is a totally different story. First, health insurance is terrible. I've never worked for a company or even heard of any company that offers top-line health coverage for management only, and then standard / low quality coverage for all other employees. That should speak for itself of how they feel about their front line employees vs management. Management is AWFUL from the top all the way down. They are money hungry looking to collect anything they can from innocent seniors who are just looking for a place to call home, and to enjoy the remainder of their lives in a community. Management and HR do NOT have your back no matter what. They do not stand up for you or back you up regardless of the circumstances. The turnover rate is insanely high, and I've never known a company that will fire an employee at the drop of a dime. The amount of employees that have been fired from ELS is unbelievable. They take their time to fire the employees that should have been fired instantly, vs letting go of their hardworking front line employees for simple things just because they can and for the sake of budget or for a simple complaint. Working hard, putting in your hours plus overtime and going above and beyond your job description will never be enough to save you from losing your job. If you claim to have PTSD you can get away with literally anything. Anything including (but not limited to) getting coworkers fired, getting residents evicted from their home of 30+ years, contacting your bosses boss every day in hopes of getting your boss fired by reporting her daily activities to her boss, not working a full 40 hr. week due to being triggered and needing to go home, just to name a few. The company chooses to keep people like this instead of those who have dedicated themselves to their job, and who take action to make changes for the better. ELS is also way behind the times in terms of the way they do things, and the technology, programs, practices, etc. which I found very bizarre. The bottom line here is that HR is extremely sneaky and can not be trusted. The way they go about things is not right and I would not recommend ELS to anyone. Ever.

Together we restored the park to a desireable place for the residents, gaining their confidence and improving their experience in the park. I've enjoyed the interactions with them, taken on some heavy projects and can take pride in what we've done in just 3 short years.
cons: This is a huge corporate entity based in Chicago. Primarily a resort/campground operation, they seem to be out of touch with what's happening "on the ground" at their manufactured home parks. They're big on procedures & reports that don't relate to what we're doing. We're "numbers" is the impression I get. Pay is low for what I'm doing, and recognition for our progress is non existent. People at their other properties are content to ride around in golf cars, shirk away from any real work and burn down the clock. Corporate doesn't seem to notice either work ethic, and raises are arbitrarily based on tenure as opposed to performance. Again, out of touch. Their few corporate visits are unwelcome, as I was admonished for having a "sloppy" maintenance yard when at the time I had several major projects under way. You can't eat waffles without getting a little syrup on the fork.

title: Too big to fail?

cons: Poor pay, terrible support from upper management, once hired your on your own but still get criticized for not doing things ‘properly’. Terrible benefits and from regional management up they do not give a hoot about you.

title: Great company

title: Great place to work

title: Happy to be here
pros: Regarding the company in general, there is a great culture. We are always trying to find ways to improve processes and be more efficient. Everyone is very open to new ideas. I have heard people mention this is the "smallest large company" or the "largest small company", and I agree. We have a lot of employees, but you still get the family feel. Everyone is very collaborative within and across departments. Additionally, it is nice to hear that a good amount of employees have been here for 10 or 20 years and have been able to grow in their careers so much within the company. Each department is slightly different, but overall, this has been my experience within my department specifically. My manager is very supportive and kind. I have a great work/life balance. When I propose ideas, I am able to implement them quickly, which sometimes does not happen in big companies. I feel challenged without feeling overwhelmed.
cons: Again, each department is different. For my department, I would say just continue working on improving documentation processes. This can have a positive impact on accountability and communication. Additionally, I know most people hate meetings and it may seem crazy to suggest more, but I feel that we might not have enough meetings. I would encourage perhaps a monthly meeting to see what each sub-area within my department is currently working on. This can help to keep everyone in the loop and provide an opportunity to identify additional ways we can collaborate and improve our practices.

title: Nice

cons: Bad news for me and I was going through the wrong thing to get

pros: very good operation in terms of getting things done

title: Change in employment hours
pros: I thoroughly enjoyed being employed as a full time housekeeper with Equity Lifestyles. Working year round, cleaning all restroom buildings, rentals varied immensely depending on the season. Meeting and greeting the members was always changing from day to day. Driving the company van on the property during my shift saved time because this was over 200 acres, and at the time there were several travel trailers, four cabins, the Adult Lodge with four motel style rooms to rent including four park models that were eventually sold. There also was a large seven bedroom with two restrooms, one has a shower. Moreover, I still believe they have four buildings that are Men & Women restrooms with showers. The other building was a laundry room. Correction, the laundry machines were moved to the basement in Family Lodge which has Men & Women restrooms with no showers, the management office; and room to sit and visit, or even have an indoor event. As you can tell, I really miss that place!
cons: Seasonal employment, loss of benefits.

title: Like Home
pros: Family resort with great team
cons: Lack of staffing which causes unnecessary hardship

title: Impressive combination of consistency and innovation
pros: My personal time is valued by my superiors, peers, and direct reports. Team building and customer satisfaction are high priorities and leadership fully comprehends potential impact of success and failure. Everyone strives to consistently improve upon both, with honest dedication to excellence.
cons: A history of quick and poorly made hires/ promotions has created hardship for team members with ability or high potential. Waiting periods are imposed despite occasions where management level team members are identified but were hired at property level rather than recruited through corporate talent acquisition. This may lead quality employees to seek opportunities elsewhere- a great disadvantage and time drain to all levels of property staff and leadership.

title: Conditions
pros: Pto is great. Work life balance or so called is decent
cons: Everything under the sun. Everyone and culture us terrible

title: Monte Vista Resort great for guest but poor pay for workers.
pros: Workers and volunteers alike get discounts on events and freebies on certain food events. Get to use all amenities at the resort. Full time employees get benefits and holiday pay, part-time they get a schedule they desire and changes are very easy to happen.
cons: Pay is very low, part-time workers get to receive minimum pay. Most of the part-time workers work round the clock. The security team uses golf carts to patrol the resort, however there is always repair issues on the carts. The front office has to deal with upset guest on charges that are in error. There is always errors. The laundry pay card is located in the lobby which is open from 6am to midnight, however the laundry room is open 24 hours, and why have the guest walk to another building for cards that is only used in the laundry room.

title: Hard work, crap management
pros: Paid time off. My staff are wonderful people which makes it the ONLY good reason I enjoy coming to work.
cons: Upper management does not take any concern with what it takes to run a property. From property management on up; they are all pencil pushers. You can not plan anything because that choice is taken from you. People who work in Chicago and the local corporate office ( sitting behind computers doing reports) will dictate what you do; not taking into consideration you have more important things to do then stage a home. Hire someone for that; maintenance shouldn't have to do it. Then you get thrown under the bus by management because the property isn't being kept like it should. There is little room for growth UNLESS you just came out of college and have no idea what you are doing. Fast turn over due to lack of appreciation. I do the assistant managers job but they refuse to promote because that would pay more. I have already been told I'm stuck where I'm at....

title: Accounting culture based in the 80s
pros: There is a great spirit of entrepreneurship and freedom to "run the business" at the property level. The corporate office does offer various activities in an attempt to engage employees that are fun and different.
cons: The corporate office is not a very modern culture with extremely outdated technology and a culture focused on quantity not quality. A "get it out the door" and "put a band-aid on it" kind of approach, versus a focus on taking the time and resources to get initiatives activated and accomplished with quality at the forefront. It's unfortunate because there are a lot smart, talented people at ELS that can add a lot of value but are stifled. Coupled with a leadership that gives the "pat on the back" only at quarterly investment calls, it's a culture of investors first employees a distant second. No regular internal communications, no leadership engagement, updates on strategy or where the company is headed. I think it must be even harder at the property level, as they are truly in the dark on any initiatives happening at corporate and will rarely if ever have any kind of communication/engagement with leadership.

title: Worst Place I've Ever Worked
pros: Location. Some people in some departments get to work from home sometimes.
cons: Chicago office is disorganized and unruly. Most departments have very inefficient and old systems. Most departments are either micro managed or not managed at all. Salaries and bonuses are low.There is a ridiculously high amount of turnover. Employees in all departments are just spending their days putting out fires. No real investment into the Chicago employees, their well-being, their growth, their chances at other job opportunities. Benefits are so expensive. Middle management is not good at all, and not supportive, because they're just there because no one else was around long enough to take the job. People at all levels, except executives, are very unhappy, unproductive, and uncooperative.

title: It's a job.
pros: I can count on 40 hours a week, a dependable paycheck although pay should be more competitive.
cons: The software or servers need improvement. It goes down or is slow slow slow even during the summer months which is the off season. You imagine the frustration when trying to check in guest during high season. Guest are stacked 3 deep in the office just trying to check in which should take a few short minutes but when the server is being difficult or freezes, there is nothing you can do but stand and wait for it to catch up. It is the absolute worse part of the job. Also, because managers are salaried, mine comes in late, leaves for a 2 or 3 hour lunch, returns or maybe not. I have never seen my boss work a 40 hour week since Ive been employeed here. Because of this, I am not disgruntled at all. Please do not misunderstand this. But at this point in time, its almost easier for the manager to work part time and stay out of my way and let me do my job... and sometimes hers.

title: Sales Manager
pros: I love what I do. Micro-management is at a minimum. You have the ability to think and act somewhat freely. Once you've proven you're able to work unsupervised, your opportunities are open.
cons: Support to staff has somewhat gone to the wayside. There is a strong sense of service but nothing backing it up. The incentives are gone. No carrot to chase plus unreasonable expectations in the off chance a random bonus could be had. Random cuts to pay. No one for some staff to go to for advice on how to handle inner-management issues. Certain employees get a pat on the back when it's the core employees making it happen. The data systems are out dated.

pros: Very laid back company too laid back if you ask me. You do build great relationships with your co workers which is the main reason many stay. It’s a great place to start and get experience to then leave.
cons: They push Collaboration but it’s not really the case. Every company has those who work hard and those that do the minimum. It’s hard to understand those who do the minimum are rewarded and recognized. There needs to be more accountability across the board for everyone and really listen to the concerns instead of pushing them under the rug. No development at all which equals no growth

title: Worst Company I've Ever Worked For
pros: Great commission structure ~ until it was cut. For some, in half. Enjoy my co-workers.
cons: Impossible to name them all. I am continually shocked that ELS is a publicly traded company, and a successful one, at that. It's a testament to how hard the employees work. No systems in place for inventory. The entire company runs on Google docs, as it's too cheap to invest in quality systems. When I started, the email platform was Lotus Notes. Hello, 1979. IT is a joke. Regional VPs micromanage to death, new policies and procedures are introduced daily, but are never thought out long-term. This results in someone figuring out they don't work and replacing them with new ones that were also not thought-out. It's a vicious cycle. The health "insurance" is a joke. I pay $200 per month for a $2k deductible ~ for a single person. I cannot wait to land a new job and tell this company to get bent.

title: This is my career not my job!
pros: I have felt welcomed since the moment I walked through the door in the Tampa office. The work environment is fast paced but there is always someone that is willing to help! The company invests in their employees and provides you with the tools you need to succeed. ELS is continuing to grow and I plan on growing with them! If you want a career where you feel appreciated and where you can grow within the company ELS is the company for you. I suggest making it known where your goals are and they will help you reach them. I have had all levels of employees introduce themselves which makes you feel that there is no one too busy to reach out to if you need assistance.
cons: Since the company is continuing to grow in all aspects there are things that could use a second look. I do feel confident that within the next 2 to 5 years ELS will be light-years farther than they are now.

title: So much potential!
pros: The customers and guests really show their appreciation for the staffs hard work and dedication. I'll keep coming to work knowing that at least I can bring a smile to some folks faces and and be the difference between a wonderful vacation and boring one.
cons: No matter how hard you work, it seems your still just digging your own grave. Management makes it feel like, if your not working in the office, your expendable and below them. The pay is definitely not competitive and not on par with the demands of the job. For lower level employees there's really not much upward mobility or even much motivation to go above and beyond.

title: Good company with potential to be great.
pros: Great new talent has been added throughout the organization, in the senior leadership roles, property level management and property level support members.
cons: There are a few legacy employees that are resisting the change which causes change to be slow and at times painful. Historically, the HR department is slow to support moving employees out that don't fit the future. While, the stability is great, it really is not the ideal situation for the employee that really needs to go or the person that is trying to impact change or believes in the new direction.

title: Reap the Rewards
pros: Comaraderie... Working as a park manager with ELS can be very rewarding. As a Park Manager we are given the tools and authority work as if we are self employed. Follow the guidelines yet someone is always there it guide us. Budgets are set but the company wants and asks for our input. Great working team environment up and down the ladder. The company wants to see you succeed, you need to be willing to put in the effort to reap the rewards. The company recognizes those who are committed. Feel as if you are part of a big family.
cons: The company has acknowledge the much needed change toward improvements in technology because of the growth in the RV industry. Therefore, they understand the need to invest funds to improve infrastructure and upgrades to old existing technology. Unfortunately this will take time. But getting there.

title: THIS COMPANY DOES NOT PAY THEIR EMPLOYEES ON TIME
pros: Nice low stress employment but if you do not get paid for your time, it just is not worth it!!!
cons: Most incompetent, uncaring, blame-it on everyone else payroll department I have ever dealt with. First check arrived on May 12th to an address not even on my job file anywhere. They said they mailed it April 30th. Erroneously took out taxes for a different state. Refused to give me a W-4 for 2 weeks after hired. Final paycheck was supposedly mailed from Augusta Ga. on Friday May 15th to Walton County Fl and it still has not arrived as of May 22nd. They use ADP and each company blames it on the other. Each company gives different information so you just do not believe either company. DO NOT WORK FOR THEM IF YOU EXPECT TO GET PAID ON TIME!!!!!

title: Great Company for Long-Term with lots of growth- A++
pros: This company, from Corporate to Property level, treat their employees as part of interactive team. Always open to changes and lots of growth potential. They are always encouraging to promote from within. If there are issues, they are always addressed and look for ways of improvement. Many dedicated employees at this company who have worked here for a long time. Very friendly environment with lots of inter-department interaction. You don't have your typical stuffy executives here. They are smart, dedicated and down to earth people, who will always talk to you and extend that friendly "Hi!" when you see them. It's always been that way here.
cons: In any job, there are some busy times, which may require long work hours.

title: IT Professionals "DO NOT WORK HERE"
pros: I would not consider this a pro myself, but some people may. If you are the type of person that likes to just sit around and find projects, task, mundane and trivial assignments to do, then this is the perfect place for you. If you like to sit under the radar and just do enough for that day, then this is the place for you. If you like going on extensive expeditions to find meaningful work to do, then this is the place for you. If you like not having any communications with your manager, director and team members, then this is the place for you. If you like getting paid for really doing all day, then this is the place for you. If you not being challenged and instead fill your day joking around to pass the time, then this is the place for you. I could go on and on and on. Get the picture?
cons: NO BUDGET, NO COMMUNICATION, NO TEAM BUILDING, NO TEAM COMMUNICATION, NO DIRECTION, NO DELEGATION, NO LEADERSHIP, NO PROJECTS, NO EFFECTIVE CIO TO LEAD THE DEPARTMENT and LOW PAY

title: I Still Think Of The Place As A Joke
pros: Great people at the property level. Decent amount of days off.
cons: If your not in upper management, your nobody to those that are. I've never worked for a company that does not appreciate input to improve processes or general satisfaction of those people working hard at the property level. There are quite a few "sketchy" practices with those at the top. When making decisions to build profits, the upper management chooses to reduce commissions from those under them. Really not a place you are going to feel appreciated.

title: Thousand Trails? More like a Thousand Oh Wells Honey
pros: Honey. The only pro is to keep you at your desk is they bring you food and I do mean lots of food. I gained 55 pounds working here (not even joking). Money was nice. When they didn’t forget to pay your commission bonus and you have to wait 2 more weeks to get it....
cons: Everything. Literally the hours of having to be there until 10. Was BRUTAL. You had absolutely no time in your day to do anything else. Commission was doubled on the weekend but with inconsitancey in other coworkers, you could be one of 3 that shows up to work and you’re forced to take call after call after call after call.....

title: Great experience until ELS acquisition
pros: The people whom you provide service to are the real reason we are in business. If you genuinely were concerned about the comments of its customers then you would actually do something about it across the board not based on which properties are more profitable because in the end they are all our customers and they are financial contributors. #classactionlawsuitELS for not honoring contracts.
cons: Senior management is top heavy and out of touch with reality and has no clue what it takes to run the communities. The operating budgets are unrealistic and they are bleeding the communities dry. Once they extract every dollar possible from its customers they will offload the properties onto someone else. Just before that happens they will begin to systematically terminate it's experienced managers and their salaries in exchange for a lower salaried employee who they to will bleed dry while showing a gradual increase in profits by shrinking their payroll expense ultimately making their NOI appear better than it actually is

title: Best not to start so that you don't get caught up in the mistruths that you are promised
pros: The supposed quarterly managers meetings, that really don't happen quarterly. At least you get to meet with the other managers and there is an attempt, at least at those meetings, to try for consistency in policy, at least for those two days.
cons: Too many to list, lots of great managers resigned over the last year and it is really too bad that we are not afforded an exit interview. In all the years I was there not one formal review was ever conducted. You are expected to work all kinds of hours and though there is a yearly bonus it is dependent on whether your rm or vp likes you, it certainly isn't based on the amount of revenue brought in by the manager. Too top heavy in management which lends to constant change of plans for future movement of the property.

title: Manager
pros: Beautiful Atmosphere: you're in the Florida keys Lots of site seeing, boating, fishing, and water sports Employees actually care about the clientele and strives to make their stay one to remember
cons: When you get a promotion and told you will get a raise but that never happens, added to the fact that you have never been welcomed by the "Click" or the older regime that wants everything to back to what used to be. This facility is not employee or people friendly, why would anyone want to belong! Already looking for my next adventure!

title: a job with no future, with a company that does not care
pros: i worked well with the on site staff and property manager. nice property and enjoyed working for most of the residents.
cons: very high demands from corporate. as a maintenance supervisor I was on call 24/7 expected to perform quality work, manage several employs and perform a wide rang of jobs out side of my job description. I did all of this without objection. i was reworded with a 2 percent pay increase after 3 years. the pay was way below industry standers and i was offered substandard insurance that was insulting. ELS does nothing for its employs that shows it cares to retain good employes for the long term. Dead end job

title: Very Happy With My Decision To Work Here
pros: Work Life Balance is amazing here you! No one is watching you come and go and working from home is an option as well. Its all about getting what you need to get done. There are not KPI's its is a do your job environment and show me the results, which I think creates more motivation. The culture is great people are very friendly and their are get togethers to meet with everyone. Plus the industry is pretty neat I never saw myself working with real estate in particular campgrounds, rv's, and modular homes but its pretty cool and comes with some perks. You also have an opportunity to switch departments and learn about different areas you may not of known you were interested in.
cons: It's quiet in the office

title: Outstanding & Engaged Organization
pros: I have had the privilege of working for some outstanding leaders and companies over the years. I can say without hesitation that this company has been the most rewarding and has the most engaged, intelligent and compassionate Leaders I've ever worked with. ELS offers a competitive benefits package, training programs and most importantly a respectful, challenging, engaging and fun environment to work in.
cons: Because we are such a large organization, it would be nice to be able to meet some of our partners who work in our Corporate Chicago office. They are always available by phone, but it would be great to put a face to name. Otherwise, I cannot think of any cons.

title: Beware - ELS is not a good career move.
pros: ELS has work life balance down. People come in around 9am and leave around 4:30pm. Each day everyone is allowed to wears jeans, which is nice when the weather is bad. According to the President, which he recently told all Chicago employees at an all company meeting, regardless of the fact that no raises have been given to some people in four years, "we are lucky to have a job."
cons: No respect from the president or anyone in senior management, which trickles down to each department. There is no team attitude at ELS. Heavy turnover in key departments because of lack of respect. No raises in four years. Managers do not set out a clear defined career path for thier employees. HR has indefinable control over hiring, firing and pay.

title: ELS is a Solid Place for Career
pros: - Corporate world, business casual attire, casual atmosphere - Executives on down all feel like family. Very close and open. Open door policy seems real. - Relaxed, adult like environment. Be responsible, get work your done and you can do whatever - Company get togethers, events, parties, lunches, etc - Travel opportunities - Benefits include: Perks/discounts when staying at ELS properties and with third party vendors - Busy work and growth opportunities - Open minds to new ideas
cons: - Communication between corporate, regional offices and local properties is sometimes difficult - Hard to connect or get on same page with local properties - Lots of "cooks in the kitchen" on certain projects - Better/more healthcare and dental options - Still "old school" ways of doing things. Could use updated technological advances to make things run smoother

title: Unique company to work for in a diverse, fun, and growing industry!
pros: Whether you work in the corporate or regional offices, communities, or campgrounds, the people are the best part about this company. Also, there are so many different career paths the company offers. Every day presents a new set of challenges and no day is the same. It is a truly fun, unique and exciting industry to be in. Outdoor hospitality and MH communities will continue to grow in popularity and profitability for years to come.
cons: The company's culture is fast moving and some departments wear many hats, so be ready to be super busy and take on a heavier workload than other companies. This doesn't apply to all departments and positions though.

title: Now is the time to be with ELS
pros: ELS has made drastic improvements to the company culture here. The home offices have improved support to the property level in every aspect. The focus is on the teams and the customers now. On boarding and training is a major focus. Team members are encouraged to take ownership and innovate in regards improving the customer experience. The culture is bottom up now as opposed to top down. Learning and development has done a great job implementing these cultural changes. Now is the time to be with ELS! - All employees receive a free membership to Thousand Trails for quality time off with family.
cons: Compensation is on the lower end of the median.

title: lacks effort. Due to senior management just is okay to meet the budget
pros: Stock Investmet and decent healthcare
cons: Not understanding the current trend and not believing on the property level management.

title: Where Do I Begin!
pros: I HAD a great immediate supervsor!
cons: Low pay, long hours, micromanagement, demoralizing conference calls, repetitive financial reporting, poor beneifts with the exception of PTO. I have been in asset management my entire career and am still shocked after 9 years of employment with ELS that it is preferred to allow deferred maintenance and asset deterioration. We, as managers, are expected to give great customer service with no tools to do so. We are pricing ourselves out of our respective markets and continually lose business to competitive properties that complete upgrades and add amenities. The bottom line to stock holders is the only thing that really matters. I have never stopped looking for another company to spread my professional competencies to. If this job market ever regains a postive ground, I'm out.

title: Nothing but lies and broken promises
pros: Some of these locations could be the best in the county.
cons: Since the day I set foot on this property, it has been nothing but smoke screens and lies. Everyone blames everyone above them for the problems. No one is held accountable for anything. And nothing gets done. There is no structure. People do what they want. Management changes have become a common occurrence. You don't try to get to know your co-workers..they wont be here long anyways.

title: Dynamic environment; shape your work and see the impact
pros: Leadership is investing more in our people and attracting impressive talent! Although the company has been around for a long time, we still have a really entrepreneurial environment. If you see a challenge, take it on, collaborate with others and solve the problem together. While the people work hard, people also know how to have fun and joke around along the way. While we're a large company, we are also small enough to witness the impact of your work. It's remarkable to see when you're making a difference for the business and organization - something rare in companies of this size.
cons: We could improve our documentation of processes to reduce some confusion.

title: maintenance
pros: you don't have to work very hard. as they wont spend money on materials to work with. pick materials from dump and recycle.
cons: Place is really a crap hole. they're too cheap to buy material to work with. Have to get what's needed from dump. no joke. cesspools constant overflowing and stink of raw sewerage most all ways in the air. Customers come absolutely last. Top priority is making employees job easier. only way to get along is to gossip about residents. by doing so you don't have to work just hang in office and talk and wait for clock to time out. hard to work with people so dumb. you need to save bottles and cans to make extra money because pay is so bad. we ask the guest and residents to save their empty returnables for employees. now that is sad but true.

title: Overall Great Employer
pros: This is one of the first companies I have ever worked for that shows great employee appreciation. Not only do they show that they value you as as employee but they will acknowledge & celebrate your successes with you. Good Pay w/benefits General information sharing within company Opportunity for advancement Team atmosphere
cons: Inadequate Training and or manuals to guide in how to navigate company softwares, general company routine guidance or manuals so that new employees can navigate in their new positions. Calling people for help is okay but very taxing after a while when you have different people to call for every different thing and being new can have you calling a million people even for the smallest things. Having some sort of guide or manual can help alleviate that or at least some of that.

title: Quality Employment
pros: ELS is definitely moving in the right direction. They are a company that cares about their employees, their employee's families and the work life balance. There is a lot of work to do and we all work hard to accomplish it but they strive to offer some balance. ELS wants to hear from their employees and does their best to make the jobs of the employees in each role as efficient as possible. Processes are becoming more streamlined, L&D has vastly improved and ELS is investing in developing their leaders. Overall, ELS has its imperfections but it's a quality place to work.
cons: Although improving, more communication between corporate and the properties is crucial.

title: Manager
pros: I have worked for the company longer than other people who have posted here and there is a reason for why I’ve been here for years. New personal and professional learning and growth opportunities present themselves every day. The company is vibrant and dynamic and “stepping up” is recognized and encouraged. It is exciting to see the growth of the company and where it is headed. It’s rewarding to be a part of it!
cons: Sometimes when positive changes are in the works, it is easy to be impatient and possibly not see the bigger picture and the fact that some things will take time. That is probably true of any work environment, though.

title: Regional Manager
pros: I work with a great group of people that enjoy coming to work each day. The company in my opinion, is improving a great deal with employee relations as well as resident relations and service. I think the future of the company is bright. Once you are fully integrated into the organization, you have a pretty stable career with advancement opportunity.
cons: I feel a little underpaid for the value that I am bringing to the team. I think we could be a little more proactive at times.

title: Good company and getting better
pros: People are ethical and focused on the overall goal Extremely collaborative Non Toxic Environment Few blockers above you stopping your advancement Treats employees and customers fairly Diverse
cons: Sometimes hard to get things across the finish line, due to additional meetings needed. Lacking solid Policies and Procedures Lacking proper transparency on certain KPI numbers

title: Dissapointed
pros: Staff and co workers are great
cons: Its all about the sales and their gain

title: Good Regional Corporate Environment
pros: My direct supervisor and VP were wonderful to work for. They offered great support. They allowed me to determine my own methods for completing various duties. They sought out and truly valued my feedback. I was able to work with Regional Managers and Vice Presidents on a daily basis and was often included in important decision making. I left due to family medical issues. I wish I could have stayed with the company. The company is growing and offers opportunities for personal growth and professional growth.
cons: The only con is the medical insurance. It may have changed by now, but it was a high deductible plan with a high monthly premium.

title: Marketing
pros: Laid back, casual and friendly environment.. The location is awesome! The company is making significant improvements to systems and technology across departments. I find the culture to be entrepreneurial and exciting for people looking to bring new ideas to the table and interested in seeing them through.
cons: with employees spread all over the country its not always clear who the right point of contact is. Some systems are outdated which slows down productivity and can take some time to learn.

title: Look Elsewhere
pros: I wish I could offer some. At first they seem to be a great company...
cons: I have worked for other companies but was excited to come work for ELS. In the months that I have been here, I have seen such uncaring people that lie all the time, starting with the HR team. They make you feel like you are a criminal and are not understanding of life circumstances. My family and I were very excited to work for ELS and they initially seemed to treat me like a family. I left a good job, took less pay but decided to give ELS a chance and I feel taken advantage of. I would ask a lot of questions and speak to previous employees before going to work for them in a corporate capacity. They also ask their team members to submit glowing glassdoor reviews in order to increase their score.

title: Great REIT, Great People
pros: This is a great company and everyone is working towards the same goal. There are weekly calls where each region discusses what the challenges are and how everyone is overcoming them. There is a lot of built in support. Everyone recognizes the secret to the success of a large corporation is at the site level with the people onsite. Its a great company with good people.
cons: Its a REIT so there are a lot of reports and a lot of procedures. While its great that in a REIT you can pick up a phone, and speak to a subject matter expert, it also generates a lot of reports and creates a lot of procedures. On the bright end, I have never seen our procedures getting in the way of doing the right thing.

title: IT Professional Stay Away
pros: Overall the company is fine may not be the best but a good group of people trying to do what they can with limited resources. However, stay away from IT unless you like working for someone that intimidates you and treats you like dirt unless you are his manager
cons: The company has potential but operates on hierarchial top down approach without much consideration for staff employees. If you want to be treated like a professional it will be hard to come by and you are given few opportunities for growth. I worked in the IT department and the head of the IT department bullies everyone below him.

title: Great work experience, terrible management
pros: You will get tremendous experience working in a relentlessly chaotic & unorganized environment. Anywhere you work after here will seem like a cake walk.
cons: Upper management makes employees lower in the ranks do all the dirty work, and often times do their job. It's classic corporate America. I have never worked for a place that treats people who work so hard so terribly. The pay is embarrassing, the benefits are sub-par. The turnover rate says it all. Also the rate at which they randomly decide to fire huge amounts of corporate staff with zero transparency. This is the most toxic place I've ever worked. I made some great friends & worked with a handful of wonderful people but honestly, stay away from this place. They are backwards.

title: Stagnant and not future outlook
pros: Some of the people are good tow work with and a great place to start if you plan to leave after a few month for a better job once get foot in the door.
cons: Lack of vision and more of a reactive environment than a proactive. Every day is working in the problem of the day rather than working to address known future issues. Company has pathetic pay structure for bonus and raises unless you are an executive. Reviews are a joke and count for nothing as managers will write reviews for you and just have you sign them,

title: Don't do it, it's a trap! Avoid ELS at all costs.
pros: Set schedule, lots of paid time off
cons: Everything. Don't be tempted by the PTO. Benefits are terrible with the most backwoods knock off insurance for property members (Corporate gets the standard BCBS) Never worked in such a toxic and unstable environment. The corporate construction team have no idea and are mostly fresh out of college with their Construction Management degree. Getting answers from anyone to find out what is going on is impossible. Everything and everyone is off schedule and nothing ever goes the way it is supposed to. Closing 3 and 4 months after scheduled closing date is the standard and praised I guess. Can't get necessary office supplies like TP, hand soap, etc. Please do yourself a favor and skip ELS.

title: Very dissapointed one of the worst jobs I have ever had!!!
pros: starting pay is ok until you find out how much they expect from you!
cons: No raise in a year and a half. Management takes credit for subordinates ideas. No advancement opportunity. Maintenance is treated poorly and like we are of little to no value. Maintenance is overworked with no acknowledgement of hard work. absolutely no perks or moral boosting activities. Thos company only cares about one thing, the bottom line. prospective employees beware!!! This is not a good company to work for!!!

title: low pay, junk medical,no respect if you are looking for a long term job this is not the company for you !
pros: equity is a good place to work if you are desperate for a job, until something better comes around.i do get along well with the on site staff that is the only positive thing i can say about this company.
cons: low low pay for the amount of work,health insurance is a joke not worth getting,total lack of respect for employs by upper management and they make it very clear.late 80s wages and no descent medical. CRAZY

title: It was ok
pros: Great coworkers, and fun activities
cons: odd hours and not good for work life balance

title: Too many meetings where people had great ideas but no work ethic to back up those "great ideas"!
pros: A lot of money to throw around if you know the right people. In day to day work you are dealing with people who are vacationing at your resort so most of the time they are friendly and upbeat.
cons: Poor implementation of ideas within the company. Many resort managers had complaints dealing within the resort properties themselves. Plus their corporate office was a nightmare if you ever had to get anything done... call.. leave a message (because they are rarely at their desk).. wait at least three days... then start the long awaited process of action.

title: You have to be kidding!
pros: Community managers strive to help each other accomplish goal and daily tasks.
cons: Non responsive upper management. Last minute email to complete useless reports they already have access to. The only real training is from fellow employees. Constant changes to policies with no information being passed on the the properties. Blatent ridicule by upper manager with no regard to the employee working their back sides off. Procedures are changed constantly. Pay scale sucks unless you sell high end home every week.

title: Low pay, no respect for manager's not a good company to work for to much basis on hear say, drunks control the park
pros: A good place to work if you want a short term job, Park was nice with a beautiful lake
cons: Low pay, total lack of respect from upper management, only went by hear say Expected you to work 24 /7 with no additional help, upper mangement only cares what can you do never wants to give back to their parks unless it a high dollar making park, gives you little equipment, never follows through with what they say, its a wonder why equity has such a turn over in management, etc.

title: Constant turnover, revolving door, promotions and raises based solely on relationships rather than merit
pros: Starbucks - all the time. Cushy travel budget, very casual work attire (some people in yoga pants), a lot of lunches- on them, relaxed about hours worked for salaried employees (40+ but not necessarily 8-5), access to tools needed to get the job done - ipads, mifi, cellphones - which they replace when they break.
cons: tant turnover, revolving door, promotions and raises based solely on relationships rather than merit

title: Awesome company- And extremely Successful REIT
pros: Ability to manage freely as long as you are performing well. Successes are measured by performance goals either financially or project driven. Great corporate office in Chicago to assist when necessary. Overall friendly and great atmosphere. Great ESPP which has performed extremely well since IPO.
cons: The health care coverage is weak. Limited positions at higher levels and lots of hiring from outside the company, so sometimes people struggle to grow.

title: A part timers point of view.
pros: Part time job just to keep busy during the week.
cons: Company is too micro managed. Local managers don't have much decision making authority. Takes too long to accomplish tasks. Pay is base line. Three years with the company and still at minimum wage. Smaller resorts are ignored. Even a resort always profitable can't get the funds to do needed improvements that have been requested for years.

title: Far too little concern for people
pros: Very busy work atmosphere for anyone who thrives in that environment. Everyday has it's own unique twists and turns to navigate through on your own.
cons: Far too little concern for people (other employees, vendors, guests, etc.). Very disorganized throughout which can cause chaos even in the simple day to day activities. No consistency.

title: Great organization!
pros: I have read some of the reviews and am saddened by them. I have had a great experience with Equity Lifestyle Properties. I have been here 3 years. In my three years, I have accomplished my goals of getting promoted and growing a team under me. I love the people I work with and feel like I have a lot of autonomy to get my job done successfully. The company supports organic growth and if you work hard, they recognize it. There are so many people that have been here there whole career who impart great knowledge to new people coming in.
cons: Being far apart from team members

title: Great work experience , just wish the pay scale matched the work load.
pros: Great members at location loved my job! Fun outdoor job. Always something different going on each day fast paced environment at times.
cons: Very low pay scale and multiple jobs end up on everyone because of under staff and too many restrictions on property manager with regards to budget etc.

title: Just a terrible place to work!
pros: Pay is decent, hours are good
cons: Manager is on a power trip and has a battle going on between them and the residents, let another employee intimidate and threaten me, no communication skills what so ever by the manager, my employment position was stripped of it's identity then never defined, was told by manager I was not allowed to make friends with the residents, that I shouldn't learn their names, they did not care one bit about the residents or guests, "This is MY park" yelled the manager when when I was explaining that the resident volunteers really did most of the planning for events. It was supposed to be a fun job creating fun for the residents and guests of the park, but it was not even close.

title: Property Manager
pros: FEW of the upper management have are empathetic to the reality of onsite managers. Some other property managers assist new managers when they can.
cons: Unrealistic demands and expectations without providing training, staff or funds to accomplish the dictates. Emphasis on "sales" rather than property management and resident satisfaction, devalue staff and threaten "discipline". Disjointed software and reporting requirements with a distinct lack of pertinent and timely training. Lack of support and cohesive instruction. Nasty, negative employees are kept on despite complaints - likely due to low wages.

title: Go TEAM
pros: Nice people to work for and has given me the opportunity to meet people/community that watches out for other's and lends a helping hand in a time of need.
cons: I feel the number of Mgmnt. changeovers in the last 3 or 4 years has created various issues with the community. Sometimes, I Didn't feel fully recognized by mgmnt or my supervisor for some of the work I did,outside of my regular housekeeping duties,without being asked/instructed to do so or for ideas or suggestions. No coordination/cooperation for "TEAM" projects. (no I or U in "TEAM"...= at least 2). Communication line has a gap.

title: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
pros: Highly collaborative culture with a true open-door policy. This is a company that is taking the time to listen to their employees and to use what they learn to improve and change.
cons: With a company this size, change takes time. It can also be a challenge to get the word out about programs and opportunities to all members of the organization.

title: Fun, New Adventures, Family Atmosphere
pros: I truly enjoyed my career. Employees always like to put the blame on the company. Sometimes you need to sit back and look at yourself. I found my career very rewarding, getting promoted when the times were right due to my hard work. I love the travel and new challenges presented all the time. A career is what you make of it, don't wait for others to get you ahead!
cons: Salary could be better for the amount of work put in.

title: Unhappy, unappreciated employee!
pros: Close to home, great commission incentives.
cons: Health insurance offered is garbage for a multi billion dollar corporation. I see promotions and raises offered to people on email blasts company wide but I havent had even a .01% raise in the 3 years I have been here. I have no opportunity's given for advancement and hard work isnt appreciated unless it also comes with a bit of butt smooching. I feel like taking a loss in pay just to find somewhere else to be appreciated at. I hate that they expect everything from you but never give you anything more than what you originally were offered when Hired. I have finally hit my breaking point. I have never even had an evaluation in 3 long years.

title: Amazing People and Management
pros: The company has been around for long enough to know what they are doing right and wrong. The sense of community you have when you join ELS is amazing. The Executive Team really seems to care about their employees both professionally and personally. Although they are a public company and nationwide you still feel important to the overall sucess. I feel confident in being a part of this company because of the longevity of peoples careers here.
cons: There hasn't been anything that I could complain about.

title: Great place to have a career!
pros: 1)No micromanagement. In my years at ELS I have been able to manage my own projects with guidance and help from my supervisor, and no micromanagement. I was encouraged to seek guidance, but I was able to take ownership of my projects. This encouraged my creativity while providing the support needed to be successful. 2) The people. I feel that I have been very lucky in all of my 10+ years here because I have worked with the best people of my career. Before coming to ELS, I worked at 3 other large companies. The people here at ELS have impressed me every day. All of the people I have worked for have inspired me to get to the next level and I learned so much along the way. Also, I had fun doing it which is such a plus! 3)Casual and fun atmosphere. Here at ELS we have casual dress. This just helps to set the tone where you do not have to worry about what wear, within reason of course. This provides a casual atmosphere where you can get down to business and focus on what is important. 4) We are a successful company. It has been a pleasure to work for a growing company and I take pride in knowing that my contribution helped in our growth. 5) Open door policy. Over the years, all of my supervisors have had an open door policy. I was encouraged to come to them with any issues I was having. They left it up to me to determine if I needed extra help with projects or just wanted to vent. This environment helped to make me feel supported. It is now easier for me to set that same tone for my staff, since I have had such great examples.
cons: The only con I can think of is that, like all large companies, we have deadlines and stressful projects. These projects can result in occasionally working long hours and at times having to tell others news they would rather not hear. The good thing about ELS as it relates to these types of projects, is that you are encouraged to contribute to a solution, own up to your own mistakes and move on to implement that solution.

title: Amazing Company
pros: ELS is an amazing company to work for. I believe they care about their teams and they have great benefits. I just love the company and all senior management! I look forward to enhancing my career with the company for many years to come.
cons: HR is not timely when you are doing documented write ups on those certain associates that need reprimanding. Timely follow up when an incident happens is very important in my opinion. The company is very slow when it comes to asset management (projects) and the BC compliance is horrible

title: IT MAY BE BETTER THAN NOTHING...maybe.
pros: The company has decent wages and PTO.
cons: I have to agree with previous poster, where do you start? Commission was once great, it's no2 being taken away in large part. The upper management doesn't care one bit about people at the community level. They can't even acknowledge the holidays even though they are lavishing themselves parties and events. They do not know from one week to the next if they are sale or rentals, or sales...uughh. You cannot offer an opinion to anyone higher than you because they don't believe you are as intelligent as they are. The CEO must be blind. Our region is clearly in dirty dealings and it's obvious to everyone around. You don't dare make your concerns known since the person responsible clearly lets you know that you can be dismissed at any time. The best way to get promoted is by kissing up to the right people. Merit means nothing to these people. They have mediocre health care at best and if you are less than a manager you have even less insurance. They grandstand about all their purchases and how much those cost but do nothing for the people who work hardest to provide the company with that money. They cannot see anything long term. They are only worried about presenting the monthly numbers to the stockholders. Someone should investigate some of the obvious bad deals they continue to do with the same companies. Looks like someone is probably getting a large kickback. No person in their right mind would continue to have the company getting ripped off unless their hands were dirty. I would say I have hit all points but there simply isn't enough time. Unless you have nothing better on the horizon, don't work here.

title: Satisfied Employee
pros: High opportunity for growth within the company. We have countless success stories demonstrating that commitment including myself. Strong entrepreneurial culture. Unlike giant organizations, we are a mid-size company where you can truly have a voice that gets heard. New ideas are always welcome. We are constantly growing, striving for excellence in everything we do and looking for the next big idea to help us get there. I have personally lead process improvement teams and seen my ideas get implemented and it's a great feeling to be a part of that, lead change and work for a company that has your back and will support your interests. This isn't a company that feels certain things are not in your "lane." The company encourages and looks highly upon staff members getting involved outside of their specific job scope. The people. We are in the business of having fun and that trickles into the culture and personality of the people. I am fortunate to be able to travel to multiple properties and it is an absolute pleasure meeting everyone whom runs the business and interacts with the customers first hand. We are in the camping business so having fun is what we do, and I can only see even more opportunities to harness that potential in the near future. Recognition. I have never worked for a company and felt more appreciated. I've received the Essential Piece award, multiple informal commendations from leaders throughout and across the organization, in addition to receiving compensation increases. Strong business. You don't need to worry about your job because the stock only continues to go up throughout my entire tenure with the company. We have strong business minds running the enterprise; we have a strong business model and a track record of success in what we do. Another thing of mention is we have a female CEO. There aren't many female CEO's around the world so I think this alone speaks a lot to equal opportunity, support and the culture here at ELS. I am proud and inspired beyond what I can put to print here. Employee focus. This is a truly exciting time for the business. We've always cared about our people but we are at a pivotal time where we are putting our heads together and trying to come up with new ways to engage employees, recognize staff and create an even stronger culture. It's a very exciting time to be employed at ELS. We have unlimited potential to grow not only the business but to become a world-class preferred place of employment. I do have to say after reading some of the negative reviews on here I should add a few pieces of feedback to people looking for employment here. This will be tough if you're uncomfortable with ambiguity, need to be micro-managed or without vision and planning skills. If you want to be told what to do and delivered a recipe to success this is not the place for you. Being successful will take diligence, persistence, intentional planning, navigation of ambiguity and someone willing to roll up their sleeves. It's challenging and rewarding work. If you're looking to simply earn a paycheck this is not the place for you. If you're looking for a challenge where you want to see a visible impact, are self-motivated and dedicated to excellence and want to be a part of a rapidly growing organization... welcome. Your last stop is here with us.
cons: The one thing that could use some uplift is the company benefits. The medical package is expensive with minimal coverage and the 401K is average.

title: Equity LifeStyle Properties
pros: I love working for this company, overall I never feel like I am at work since this workplace is filled with fun and interesting people. A very friendly and inviting place to work, with advancement opportunities.
cons: As with any employer in the career world, you need to work way up. Staring salary was on the lower end of the Chicago marketplace, however after 3 years of hard work and a positive attitude I feel I am closer to where I should be.

title: ELS has been good to me and my Family
pros: Regional Management team has always been supportive and now that Marguerite has taken over, there are TONS of good things happening on the Corporate level!! Love to see the great changes over the last 13 years. Family Life Balance benefits are great, vacation time, paid personal time, paid sick leave, Free Camping Membership to Thousand Trails....
cons: Health Benefits are expensive and minimal

title: Solid company; good people; bright future; opportunity and commitment to improve!
pros: People here are generally very helpful and collaborative. The senior leaders have a demonstrated track record of results and are focusing on areas to keep improving. Is everything perfect? Nope. Is there a lot of good work going on now and plans for the near-term? Yes indeed. Glad I'm here as I see a very bright future.
cons: It's an entrepreneurial culture so they aren't heavy on consistent processes. It's fine, just be ready to adapt to a focus on getting work done.

title: Bad Executive management
pros: Variety of opportunities and roles to show your skillset on the property
cons: Shareholders meetings have driven management to cut experienced employees in favor of new employees at a low base pay to drive profits for the company and bonuses big ones for c level executives. No real central incentive programs applied fairly. Nepotistic and biased organization with low level property attentiveness. Social media and progressive crm feedback did increase.

title: Lots of Companies Talk the Talk...
pros: ...and this company walks the walk. Senior leadership is extremely open to new ideas and welcomes collaboration. Politics takes a backseat to good ideas: the company is hiring quite a bit from both the field and from outside. This fresh blood is helping the company refine its excellent market position.
cons: The organization could stand to be a bit more upfront about its weaknesses. Also, if you've never worked for a publicly-traded company, the focus on quarterly goals could confound some.

title: Solid Company
pros: The company is very stable.
cons: istent financial performance and pretty much the same leaders for decades now. ELS stock performs well and they are still growing. They also offer a good work life balance in my experience. It's a really unique area within real estate, and they have some great locations in the portfolio. It's not the biggest REIT, but it's great it you like smaller teams with less silos.

title: A great place to learn, to grow and to advance
pros: The management team grew up through the ELS organization and they strive to develop and grow their teams. The communication is open and you are encouraged to participate in finding new/better ways to continue to improve the company. Leadership is open to new perspective and welcomes the opportunity to work with groups to give them the tools and resources to continue to advance ideas. Employees are encouraged to challenge their thinking and understanding so they can also continue to grow and advance as well.
cons: Nothing to speak of.

title: Stable Company, Entrepreneurial Spirit
pros: Collaborative environment, focus on innovation, heavy investment in talent, access to senior leadership who listen to new ideas and lots of opportunities to make a difference!
cons: The Company runs lean and is going through a period of evolution. This means there's a lot of work to be done and many competing priorities. The upside to this is the ability to make an impact and learn and develop. Only a downside if you aren't looking for a challenge!

title: Frustrated with the direction the company has gone
pros: Great working environment and property level staff. Dedicate and helpful (although overworked and unappreciated) corporate support staff.
cons: Revolving door for corporate employees and Regional Management. Lack of focus and support for properties. Upper management out of touch with their guests needs. Lack of relevant marketing support. No opportunity for advancement.

title: Mismanagement
pros: Good vacation/sick days. Great commissions. The best part of my job has nothing to do with they company but the job itself & being able to assist residents.
cons: Watching management misuse company property, assests, staff & the unfair treatment of residents & vendors based on race. Management is only concerned with NUMBERS, NUMBER$, NUMBERS!! Of course i mean occupancy numbers. Poor customer relations, once residents move in they're ignored. Management actually purposely avoids residents & corporate doesn't respond to complaints.

title: Insurance and most community managers are horrible
pros: you get to help seniors
cons: Managers are not chosen by qualifications they are chosen by "friendships" and when that happens the managers dont really care about the employees just that they look good to their "friends"

title: A Company that Truly Cares
pros: Direct & open communication, warm/helpful Learning and Development team, steady opportunity for growth.... the company is clearly striving as of late to improve the quality of life for its employees, everything from more thorough training, a better flow of communication from the top down & efforts to show appreciation.
cons: Updated electronic systems, many are outdated

title: Micro managed communities
pros: Properties have wonderful value and benefits for residents
cons: Upper management has no idea how degrading and intimidating the RM behaves. The RM actually degrades VP and Corporate to management team while boasting she is the only one in Corporate that knows how to do things. Very sad to see her boast on how she can fire you at any moment.

title: Regional Manager
pros: The company is very stable and the new management team is investing additional capital into the properties. You will have a lot of opportunities to develop your professional skills and grow as an individual. The L & D department has developed some many new programs to assist with the on-boarding of new team members
cons: Due to the size of the company at times decisions may take longer than a smaller company. Be persistent and it'll happen.

title: Love this job because of location and location staff
pros: Vacation, sick time, personal time
cons: useless health care plan, low wages, raises are rare and raise percentages are tiny, all decisions are made top down - without consulting those who actually do the work on the ground level, innovation is not rewarded but punished, communication between departments or co-workers in other locations is discouraged, great customer service is expected but not enough staff to fully provide such service

title: Great Opporunities
pros: Working with your guest can be the most challenging and rewarding opportunity. You must love working with the public, and care about your staff. Your day is never the same. You will never get bored. The company has made great progress in listening to the fields wants and needs to be able to manage a top notch property. Great support from the regional and VP.
cons: Health insurance and pay scale needs some adjustments.

title: So far, very happy here.
pros: The atmosphere. Most everyone on my floor walks by and says, "hello," usually with a smile or even a wave. The people here are genuinely interested in each other's lives and there's a support for personal life away from work which is nice. There's also company gatherings a few times a year which boosts moral and gives you the chance to talk with people you might not normally see. The work. It's broken mainly into two types: Manufactured Homes and Campgrounds. Each have their own look and feel and present their own hurtles. It's creating content for multiple companies, creating media across multiple platforms, reaching out to different types of people. Having worked with companies where you sell a physical product, here we sell an experience. There's a joy that comes out of that I didn't expect. It's fun to see genuinely happy customers and provide them with material to further their community involvement while letting them know the full extent of possibilities their stay offers.
cons: Location. This is a person-by-person basis. For me, living in the suburbs I have to take the Metra into work and therefore am left to the mercy of the Metra Gods for getting in without complications. It's especially annoying when complications occur while heading home if you have evening plans. Besides that, the office is literally across the street from the train station so no complains once downtown. As for the office and work itself, I don't really have any gripes. Yes, at times the work is monotonous and you have to work overtime to get important projects done, but that applies everywhere. Thankfully if you run into an issue there's usually someone around or someone you can call to help out.

title: Good place to work
pros: The people at ELS are great to work with. The changes and additions to the Senior Management team have had a positive impact on the company. It's clear that they value the employees and are making changes where they can.
cons: Change is a slow process. Upgrading systems and processes takes time so it's hard to see it happening unless you're directly involved in that process.

title: Great people, rewarding job
pros: Leadership at all levels encourages us to do the right thing Good emphasis on customer service, responsive to reviews/feedback Fair pay Not the most progressive/creative culture, but still supportive and fun I feel like corporate / senior management is genuinely interested and committed
cons: Some old properties (campgrounds) that need a lot of work. This can be frustrating for the staff but is also job security :)

title: Not enough help with poor pay scale for employees
pros: You have the enjoyment of nature and being outdoors. Working to better safety standards. Thriving company no worries about the company going under.
cons: Ask too much of managers with not enough pay for their employees to obtain and retain qualified, quality, employees. This causes many shortages for personal and service failures. Technology is terrible, not keeping up with how quickly the company grows.

title: Regional Manager
pros: ELS is the type of company that empowers all employees no matter what position you hold. I have found my position to both be challenging and rewarding. We have fantastic support from direct supervisors, peers and corporate staff. With a company as large as we are you have the ability to grow and move to other regions should you decide to.
cons: Because we are nationwide it is tough for the company to find good medical plans to meet the needs of employees with families.

title: On-Boarding
pros: Strong and full leadership team, focused on the future success of their team. True care and passion for details and personal growth. Couldn't be happier with the experience coming on board. I've felt like the care is genuine and their is a true sense of family within the company.
cons: Chicago is too cold, and Phoenix is too hot for meetings : )

title: Best Corporate Structure
pros: The support from corporate is amazing! Training is mandatory but always fun and exciting! There is an internal university within the company which is helpful. Learning and Development Department is awesome! Upper management work with you!
cons: Not being able to have relatives in supervisory positions. Families tend to work at resorts from a young age and these individuals are well rounded for promotions and the knowledge and experience they bring can not be matched!

title: Solid company with opportunity to be even better
pros: Great people and enjoyable working environment. A company that appreciates innovative ideas and willing to make changes for the business. Can be fast-paced but manageable. Great location and easy access for all type of commuters.
cons: Many processes and procedures can be better streamlined by removing extra or redundant steps. More opportunity for diversity in senior leadership.

title: Great Company, Great Employees, & Great Management
pros: I’ve never had a job with a corporate company that cares about their employees and their families so much that they allow you to leave work to pick up your kids in a thunderstorm from school so they don’t have to walk through it most corporate companies I’ve ever worked for wouldn’t of cared.
